get.summary: Retrieve the limits of a client account.
get.description:
## Description
Retrieve the limits of a client account.
Account limits are the set of rules for capping an account defined by the responsible compliance.
(Xpollens Compliance for AGENT Partners, Partner Compliance for PSEE Partners)
## Prerequisite
To deal with this endpoint : - Partner should be authenticated

put.summary: Modify the limits of a client account.
put.description:
## Description
Modify the limits of a client account.
For Agent partners, it's not allowed to exceed the standard limits defined by the Xpollens compliance.
## Prerequisite
To deal with this endpoint : - Partner should be authenticated

get.description:
## Description The users/{{AppUserId}}/additionalBalance API allows to retrieve the amount of additional balance.

## Prerequisite The card (associated with an offer) must have the attribute split_payment is true

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: AppUserId:User identifier in the third-party application.9 characters exactly:0-9a-zAâ€“Z_-+/:.?!Â§()

put.description:
## Description The users/{{AppUserId}}/additionalBalance API allows to authorize a payment with an amount above than the authorization balance.

## Prerequisite The card (associated with an offer) must have the attribute split_payment is true

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: User identifier in the third-party application.9 characters exactly:0-9a-zAâ€“Z_-+/:.?!Â§()

requestBody.description: Additional amount(in euro)that can be used for the split payment

get.description:
## Description
The service is used to retrieve all existing bank cards already registered for a dedicated user. All information associated to the card will be displayed ## Prerequisites The existing appCardID (Bank card ID of third party partner) as well as the appUserID must be used to proceed

post.description:
## Create a top up with 3DS v2
This endpoint is used to create top up request with 3DS v2. The holder of the Xpollens account can add money to his Xpollens account using his bank card. Thus, he will debit his bank account and credit his Xpollens account with the topup. If fees must be attached to this transaction, you can fill in the "Fee" parameter in the body of the request with the amount of the fees. The bank card holder will be debited for the "Amount+Fee" ## ## Card registration during payment To register the bank card during payment, you must, in the body of the request, in the "Card" parameter, specify the "AppCardId" parameter. It will be this "AppCardId" which will be called later for the top up oneclik. If there is no need to register the bank card during payment, then you should not specify "AppCardId". This parameter is optional. ## ## ## Top up Oneclick with 3DSV2 To create a top up oneclick, you must, in the body of the request, add and fill in the "AppCardId" parameter instead of the "HFToken" parameter". This will allow you to directly call the previously registered bank card. By default, a 3DS v2 authentication is asking. You can also request a payment by subscription for reccuring payment by using the subscription mode parameter. Thus, no authentication is resquested

get.description:
## Description
This endpoint is used by a dedicated user, to consult the list of top up operations, executed from his Xpollens account.

## Prerequisite
To deal with this endpoint : - The holder account must first have executed a top up operation.

## Description
This endpoint is used by a dedicated user, to consult a specific top up operation, by the orderid.

## Prerequisite
To deal with this endpoint : - The holder account must first have executed a top up operation.

## URL parameter "OrderId" is the payment identifier in the third-party application and specified by the partner. | Parameter| Type |Format |Example |Description | |----------|--------|--------|-----------|--------------------------------------------------| | OrderId | String |X(255) |Moneyout-1 |Payment identifier in the third-party application |

post.description:
## Description
This endpoint is used to refund a top up. It is possible to fully or partially refund an operation.
By using this feature, the bank card holder will be refunded directly to his bank card, and the Xpollens account will be debited for the amount to be refunded. If there was a fee charged during the topup, then the fee will also be refunded to the bank card holder, and the Xpollens Partner's commission account will be debited with the amount of the commission to be refunded.
The amount specified in the body of the request corresponds to the amount to be refund. The fee specified in the body of the request corresponds to the fee to be refund. Each amount must be less than or equal to the initial amount of the topup. The orderid specified in the body of the request corresponds to a new orderid designating the refund operation.

## Prerequisite
To deal with this endpoint : - The holder account must first have executed a top up operation.

get.summary: Get used payment and withdrawal limits of a card
get.description:
## Description The cards/{{AppCardId}}/limits API allows you to retrieve the payment and withdrawal limits for a card as well as the outstanding amounts

## Error Code
The main possible values of HTTP code are : |HTTP Code |Error Code |Description | ------------------|------------------------|-------------------------------------| |400 | C001 |Card not found | |400 | C002 |Card not active |

get.summary: Get detail of a card operation
get.description:
## Description This cardoperations/{{orderId}} API is used to retrieve the operation details.

The main possible values of HTTP code are : |HTTP Code |Error Code |Description | ------------------|------------------------|-------------------------------------| |404 | 356 |Operation not found | |404 | 147 |User cannot be found |

parameters.description: Payment identifier in the third-party application

get.summary: Get list of user card operations
get.description:
## Description The users/{{appUserId}}/cardoperations API allows to retrieve a user's card transactions, with or without date criteria. The search period cannot exceed 7 days. Without date criteria, the api returns the complete list of operations.

## Prerequisite Partner must have the reference of the file containing the operations

## Error Code
The main possible values of HTTP code are : |HTTP Code |Error Code |Description | ------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------| |404 | 147 |User cannot be found | |400 | 919 |Invalid timespan |

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: User identifier in the third-party application.9 characters exactly:0-9a-zAâ€“Z_-+/:.?!Â§()

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date of the search period (EndDate minus 7 days if not specified)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date of the search period (current date if not specified)

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a client debt.
get.description:
## Description
Retrieve the details of a client debt. A client debt is a fund advance made by the partner to its client due to a transaction on an insufficiently funded account.
## Prerequisite
To deal with this endpoint : - Partner should be authenticated - The debt should already been created

parameters.name: orderid
parameters.description:
Payment identifier in the third-party application
<details><summary> Payment identifier in the third-party application and specified by the partner </summary>

| Parameter| Type   |Format  |Example    |Description                                       |
|----------|--------|--------|-----------|--------------------------------------------------|
| OrderId  | String |X(255)  |Moneyout-1 |Payment identifier in the third-party application |

</details>

put.summary: Modify the status of a client debt.
put.description:
## Description
Modify the status of a client debt. Allows the partner to monitor the recovery of its client debts.

| OrderId  | String |X(255)  |Moneyout-1 |Payment identifier in the third-party application |

</details>

get.summary: Retrieve the list of client debts.
get.description:
## Description
Retrieve the list of client debts. It is possible to apply a filter on the status of the debts and/or a client.
## Prerequisite
To deal with this endpoint : - Partner should be authenticated

parameters.name: request.status
parameters.description:
Client debt status
<details><summary> Client debt status referential </summary>

| Value | Description                                 |
|-------|---------------------------------------------|
| 0     | The debt has not been recovered             |
| 1     | The debt has been recovered                 |
| 2     | The debt has been closed without recovery   |

</details>

get.description:
## Description This endpoint allows to retrieve users
## Prerequisite Prerequisites to call this endpoint are : - Partner should be authenticated

## Description This endpoint allows to retrieve users
## Prerequisite Prerequisites to call this endpoint are : - Partner should be authenticated

RenewalDate.description: Reset date of the annual amount used

MonthlyRenewalDate.description: Reset date of the monthly amount used

WeeklyRenewalDate.description: Reset date of the weekly amount used

AdditionalBalanceAmount.description: Additional amount(in euro)that can be used for the split payment

Smoney.API.Models.Users.BankCardLimitsDT.description: Reduced DTO to get card limits

ATMWeeklyUsedAllowance.description: Amount used in withdrawal over the last 7 days

MonthlyUsedAllowance.description: Amount used in payment over the last 30 days

OperationDate.description: Local date and time (UTC) of the transaction at the merchant, sent to S-money with the authorization message. Never changes during  the operation life cycle.

ExecutedDate.description: Date and time (CET / CEST) of execution of the last processing on the S-money platform.

Direction.description:
Direction
 <details><summary> Direction referential </summary>

 | Context |	Description |
 |---------|-------------|
 | 1       | In / Credit |
 | 2       | Out / Debit |

</details>

Motif.description: Reason for decision (explicit when the refusal comes from S-money)

Status.description:
Operation Status
 <details><summary> Operation status referential </summary>

 | Value | Description |
 |-------|-------------|
 | 1     | Completed   |
 | 2     | Refunded    |
 | 3     | Failed      |
 | 5     | Cancelled   |
 | 7     | Expired     |

</details>

Type.description:
Type
 <details><summary> Operation's type referential </summary>

 | Value | Description              |
 |-------|--------------------------|
 | 504   | CardOperation In         |
 | 505   | CardOperation Out        |
 | 510   | CardOperation In Refund  |
 | 511   | CardOperation Out Refund |
 | 516   | ATM Out                  |
 | 517   | ATM Out Refund           |

</details>

ERT.description:
ERT
 <details><summary> Processing code referential </summary>

 | Value | Description                                 |
 |-------|---------------------------------------------|
 | 10    | Face-to-face payment, physical merchant     |
 | 2x    | Remote payments, online merchant            |
 | 4x    | Unattended vending machine                  |
 | 6x    | Quasi-cash                                  |
 | 7x    | Withdrawal (ATM, Bank Agency)               |

</details>

ActionCode.description:
Action Code
 <details><summary> Action code referential </summary>

 | Value | Description                                     |
 |-------|------------------------------------------------ |
 | 0     | Approved                                        |
 | 100   | Denied, invalid card status                     |
 | 114   | Denied, authorization server does not respond   |
 | 116   | Denied, insufficient funds or limits reached    |
 | 119   | Denied, transaction not permitted to cardholder |
 | 198   | Denied, technical error                         |
 | Other | Denied, Natixis refused the transaction         |

</details>

CardDataInputMode.description:
CardDataInputMode
 <details><summary> CardDataInputMode referential </summary>

 | Value | Description                                       |
 |-------|---------------------------------------------------|
 | 0     | Unspecified, generally used for internet payment  |
 | 1     | Manual, no terminal                               |
 | 2     | Magnetic stripe                                   |
 | 3     | Bar Code                                          |
 | 4     | OCR                                               |
 | 5     | Contact mode                                      |
 | 6     | Key entered                                       |
 | 7     | Magnetic stripe                                   |
 | 8     | Electronic Commerce                               |
 | 9     | Contactless mode                                  |
 | A     | Magnetic stripe                                   |

</details>

TokenRequestorId

 | Value       | Description         |

 | 40010077056 | FitBit              |
 | 40010075338 | Visa Checkout - VCO |

</details>

callback_type.description: Contains the callback number that indicates to the partner the file reference (is always 24)

batch_reference.description: Contains the reference of the file containing the operations.

clearings.description: Object containing all the operations processed in the festopeme

date.description: Date and Time the authorization was processed into the system Smoney Time zone reference=Zulu Time(UTC+0)

merchant_category_code.description: It allows to identify the merchant

original_amount.description: Amount before exchange,in the smallest currency division

operation_type.description: Values of operation's type are: (504: CardOperation In, 505: CardOperation Out, 510: CardOperation In Refund, 511: CardOperation Out Refund, 516: ATM Out, 517: ATM Out Refund)

operation_status.description: Values of operation's status are (1: Completed, 2: Refunded)

direction.description: Values of operation's direction for the user are (1: In / Credit , 2: Out / Debit)

clearing_date.description: Date and time (ZT) the operation was processed in the FestOpeme

OrderId.description:
Payment identifier in the third-party application
<details><summary> Payment identifier in the third-party application and specified by the partner </summary>

| Parameter| Type   |Format  |Example    |Description                                       |
|----------|--------|--------|-----------|--------------------------------------------------|
| OrderId  | String |X(255)  |Moneyout-1 |Payment identifier in the third-party application |

</details>

Status.description:
Client debt status
<details><summary> Client debt status referential  </summary>

| Value                       | Description                                 |
|-----------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| 0 (InProgress)              | The debt has not been recovered             |
| 1 (ClosedWithRecovery)      | The debt has been recovered                 |
| 2 (ClosedWithoutRecovery)   | The debt has been closed without recovery   |

</details>

Reason.description:
Client debt reason
<details><summary> Client debt reason referential </summary>

| Value         | Description                                                        |
|---------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------|
| P2P           | The original transaction related to the debt is a P2P              |
| Cardoperation | The original transaction related to the debt is a Card Operation   |
| JRI           | The original transaction related to the debt is a top-up CB unpaid |

</details>

Status.description:
Client debt status
<details><summary> Client debt status referential  </summary>

| Value                       | Description                                 |
|-----------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| 0 (InProgress)              | The debt has not been recovered             |
| 1 (ClosedWithRecovery)      | The debt has been recovered                 |
| 2 (ClosedWithoutRecovery)   | The debt has been closed without recovery   |

</details>

Street.description: Number and Street of residence's address

AppUserId.description:
User identifier in the third-party application. 9 characters exactly:
[^a-zA-Z0-9-_!Â§)(]

Role.description:
When creating the user, the role = 1
If user's onbording is validated then user's role = 2
UserRole is optional

Status.description:
Account status
<details>

| Value     | Description      |
| --------- | --------------   |
| -1        | Unknown          |
| 0         | Unconfirmed      |
| 1         | Ok               |   
| 2         | Frozen           |
| 3         | OnTheFly         |
| 4         | PendingClosing   |
| 5         | Closed           |
| 6         | WaitingKYC       |
| 7         | Opposition       |

</details>

KycStatus.description:
This is the global status of the kyc. 
<details><summary>The different status are as follows:</summary>

| Value | Description                                                                |
| ------| -----------------------------------------------------------------          |
| 5     | Initialized - demand is created for the first time                         |
| 1     | Pending - demand was created by KYC Provider                               |
| 0     | Incomplete - demand has at least one diligence received and validated      |
| 6     | Complete - demand has all expected diligence and all of them are validated |
| 4     | NomConforme                                                                |
| 3     | Accepted                                                                   |
| 2     | Refused                                                                    |

</details>

FirstName.description: User's first name. For card-manufacturing contraints, characters must be : AN or â€œ-â€œ

LastName.description: User's last name. For card-manufacturing contraints, characters must be : AN or â€œ-â€œ

BirthName.description: User's birth name. For card-manufacturing contraints, characters must be : AN or â€œ-â€œ

BirthCountry.description:
Country of birth of the user (code ISO 3166-1)
Example : "FR" for France

Alias.description:
User nickname. Maximum number of characters: 32
Regex : ^([a - zA - Z]) ([a - zA - Z0 - 9_\-\.\#\s]+)$

|7	  | Over 500000â‚¬       |

</details>
